Description: Fragment of Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Oval handle, gradual curve. Rectangular stamp. Clay fine light brown; cream slip.
Curator's comments: Possibly drawn by Petrie (Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 102, 39) though his confident reading compares ill with the wear of the stamp. Name Simylinos.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0662)
